title: Candy Spelling throws baby shower for daughter Tori
text:
Candy Spelling spared no expense when she hosted a baby shower on February 11, for her daughter Tori who is expecting her fifth child with husband Dean McDermott, a boy due in March.
The Bel Air hotel's main restaurant was the scene for the more than 50 invited guests' luncheon.
'This was easily a $40,000 event,' one source tells DailyMail.com, 'A diet soda there can set you back $10, so can you imagine the cost of renting out their main restaurant for four hours on Grammy weekend for a party?'
Party planner to the stars Mindy Weiss was hired by Candy to create the one of a kind event for baby boy McDermott.
Tori is due to give birth to her fifth child next month and her mom Candy Spelling spared no expense when she hosted a baby shower on February 11, for her daughter
A sea of blue balloons covered the ceiling at The Bel Air hotel's main restaurant, the scene for the luncheon, attended by more than 50 guests
A sea of blue balloons covered the ceiling, and 'Baby McDermott' was spelled out in blocks over the fireplace mantle, while Mark's Garden filled the space with colorful flowers.
But by far the best 'decorations' were the toy trains on tracks that playfully circled in front of each table setting.
Candy and Tori (pictured) have not always gotten along well. The relationship was especially strained after the death of family patriarch Aaron Spelling in 2008, when Tori, the self-proclaimed 'Daddy's girl' was only left $750,000 of his $600 million fortune
Candy remarked on her Instagram account, 'I especially loved the trains on the table! #choochoo!'
Tori, 43, attended the five star fete with all four of her children, Liam, 9, Stella, 8, Hattie, 5, and Finn, 4.
The menu included Tortilla soup and a tarragon chicken salad. Guests also enjoyed lemonade in a blue bottle that was creatively wrapped with a cloth and diaper pin.
Mother and daughter have not always gotten along so famously. Things really came to a head in 2006 when Tori produced and starred in the TV satire 'So Notorious,' with Loni Anderson playing a campy version of Candy.
The relationship was further strained after the death of family patriarch Aaron Spelling in 2008, when Tori, the self-proclaimed 'Daddy's girl', was only left $750,000 of his $600 million fortune.
Recently, Candy, 71, admitted that she has been footing the bill for the McDermott family, paying rent on their Woodland Hills home, the kids' private school tuition, and food.
'Candy is obviously excited about this new addition to the family and made sure Tori had a very special day,' the source claimed.
